intro: Cenostigma microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved cenostigma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds. Cenostigma microphyllum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in such habitats.
